title: Future of AI is ‘Humans Plus AI’ Not Replacing Them, Says Ex-KPMG CEO Arun M. Kumar
description: At the India AI Impact Summit 2026, Celesta Capital Managing Partner and former KPMG India CEO Arun M Kumar said India is entering a decisive phase in artificial intelligence adoption, driven by policy support, government funding and deep talent pools.
content:
Arun M Kumar on India’s AI moment, why policy is finally closing the gap, and how artificial intelligence could become a great economic leveller

title: Uzbekistan targets 12 million tourists in 2026 as AI reshapes hospitality
description: Industry representatives say artificial intelligence is now used in pricing algorithms, occupancy monitoring and customer analytics. Discussions at the Hotel Business Forum in Tashkent focused on how data tools can support capacity growth and operational efficiency.
content:
Artificial intelligence (AI) is increasingly becoming part of the operational infrastructure within Uzbekistan’s tourism sector, as the country prepares to receive 12 million visitors in 2026, according to the target set by the Tourism Committee.
Pre... [4503 chars]

title: AI Revolution: Transforming Power Supply Reliability
description: Artificial Intelligence holds the potential to enhance the reliability and quality of power supply in the country, but rapid adoption is essential, according to Central Electricity Authority Chairman Ghanshyam Prasad. Speaking at the AI Impact Summit, he emphasized the need for AI in planning, optimization, and addressing rural power supply issues.
content: Artificial Intelligence is poised to significantly improve the reliability and quality of the power supply in the country, according to Central Electricity Authority Chairman Ghanshyam Prasad. During the AI Impact Summit, Prasad highlighted the urgen... [686 chars]

title: India boots a private university from an AI summit over a robot dog controversy
description: A private Indian university has been booted from a top artificial intelligence summit in New Delhi after one of its staffers displayed a a commercially available robotic dog made in China, claiming it was the university’s own innovation
content: NEW DELHI (AP) — A private Indian university was booted from a top artificial intelligence summit in New Delhi on Wednesday after one of its staffers displayed a commercially available robotic dog made in China, claiming it was the university's own i... [308 chars]

title: BJP Hits Back at Rahul Gandhi Over AI Summit Remarks
description: Gaurav Bhatia says Congress leader should not post “ready-made” comments on artificial intelligence
content:
Taking a swipe at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's remark on the AI Summit, the BJP on Wednesday said anyone who does not have adequate intelligence should not post "ready-made" comments on social media on topics like artificial intelligence.
